entry.title: Ban all Cryptocurrency!
entry.content:
What a waste of energy this is. We are fighting climate change and all this nonsense cryptocurrency mining happens at the same time.


Plus it is a big scam - it will make a few people very rich and the rest will loose all their money.

The electricity expended mining Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies is rapidly approaching 1 percent of global usage, which is famously greater than the total electricity consumption of many smaller developed nations. SOHALE ANDRUS MORTAZAVI

entry.title: Space Attack
entry.content:
In 1996 I was crazy enough to release a instrumental hip hop vinyl LP called Space Attack featuring the hottest German hip hop producers of that time on my label Braindamage Records.


I made 660 copies of it and still today you can find them online, for example here.

The cover is from Perry Rhodan cover artist Alfred Kelsner, the graffiti on the back from Can Two.

Here is the track list:

  • Doze - Space Attack
  • Klammericious - Kungfusion
  • MoE’st Wanted Prod. & Jelly Jam - Miles Away
  • Ko Lute - That’s The Way It Should Be Done (‘92 Raw Mix)
  • Klammericious, Outsider & Doze - Cut’s & Effects
  • Cooley Blast - Coolin’ Out
  • Outsider - Outer Limits
  • Liquid Style Session - Phuture Phunk Decompression Kit
  • Scope - Cologne Costranostra!

entry.title: How can I find the Sales Area information for a business partner in SAP?

link.title: How can I find the Sales Area information for a business partner in SAP?

entry.content:
Follow the following steps in the SAP GUI.

  1. Go to transaction BP
  2. Enter the business partner number or search for the partner by other criteria.
  3. After selecting the start button, you will see the matching business partners in the table below. Double-click on the one you want to open.
  4. When you are on the business partner details dialog, check the field Display in BP role. If Customer is not selected, please do so.
  5. When Customer is selected, the button Sales and Distribution is visible. Select it.
  6. On the Sales and Distribution dialog you will find the section Sales Area, where you will find the required information.
entry.summary: Follow the following steps in the SAP GUI.

entry.title: With the small VW ID.3 to Berlin

link.title: With the small VW ID.3 to Berlin

entry.content:
Today I drove with my VW ID.3 from Augsburg to Berlin. About 600 km with just two charging stops.

In general, the car - even with the small 58kW battery - can perform on such a distance. There are just a few things that I don’t like: (1) The main display on the dashboard looks like it belongs to a toy car. No sign of the elegance of a Tesla, Audi or BMW. (2) When I set the speed to 100 km/h, it constantly switches: 99 to 100 to 99 to 100 to … it drives me crazy. (3) The way the doors are locked. I don’t get it - I always must press the button on the car key multiple times before the charging port opens or I am able to open the trunk.

Other than that, the car is just fine.
